input_text:
Job Title: Project Analyst

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Analyst, Finance

Description:
Location: Remote with ability to travel to Battle Creek, MI, Columbus, OH, Dayton, OH, Ft. Belvoir, VA, New Cumberland, PA, Ogden, UT, or Philadelphia, PAJob Description:CompTech is seeking a Project Analyst in support of the Equipment Management Services (EMS) division of our customer, the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA). The Project Analyst will participate as a senior level administrative analyst, where they will compile, type and edit periodic reports, letters, memos, proposals, manuals and cost estimates from copy or rough draft, integrate text and graphics to format cohesive presentations, use word processing application programs to produce reports, briefings and graphical enhancements, prepare spread sheets and PowerPoint presentations, review material prepared for supervisor's approval for typographical accuracy, grammar, spelling, punctuation, composition and format, prepare special reports, summaries or replies to inquiries using relevant data from other reports and documents.In addition, this role will process customer responses to project Funding Renewal packages, review and prepare acceptances for receiving and returning funding, enter and upload EMS customer funding documents, link customer funding documents to appropriate assets and notify customers when funding levels have dropped below acceptable levels, review automated expense and revenue reports for accuracy and manually create goods receipts and sales orders as necessary; research and resolves billing errors, communicate with customers via email and phone to obtain funding or answer questions, create, update and retire assets in support of newly awarded contracts and maintenance of existing contracts, upload contractual documentation to the Enterprise Business System (EBS) and ensure that the Asset Master Report (AMR) is 100% accurate at all times, prepare bulk uploads for mass updates to the EBS system, research and reconcile contracts as necessary to assist the Government Contract Specialist in support of ongoing device management, and create and maintain spreadsheets for funding, billing, and expense tracking.Minimum Qualifications:Five (5) years of expertise with Word, Excel, and PowerPointExperience with DoD budget and funding practices and Asset Tracking processesHighly attentive to detailCollege degree preferredSecurity Clearance Requirements:Public TrustEqual Employment OpportunityCompTech is committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment in which we recognize and value each otherâ€™s differences as well as fostering a culture that promotes its core values: Commitment, Innovation, and Customer Satisfaction. As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, or status as a protected veteran. If you require assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please call Human Resources at (937) 228-2667 or email stefanie.wallace@comptech.com. A CompTech associate will respond to your message as soon as reasonably possible.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Project Analyst
output_json.summary: CompTech is seeking a Project Analyst in support of the Equipment Management Services (EMS) division.
job_responsibilities: Compiles, types, and edits periodic reports, letters, memos, proposals, manuals, and cost estimates
Formats cohesive presentations using word processing applications
Reviews material for typographical accuracy, grammar, spelling, punctuation, composition, and format
Prepares special reports, summaries, or replies to inquiries using relevant data
Processes customer responses to project Funding Renewal packages
Reviews and prepares acceptances for receiving and returning funding
Enters and uploads EMS customer funding documents
Links customer funding documents to appropriate assets
Notifies customers when funding levels have dropped below acceptable levels
Researches and reconciles automated expense and revenue reports
Creates, updates, and retires assets in support of newly awarded contracts and maintenance of existing contracts
Uploads contractual documentation to the Enterprise Business System (EBS)
Ensures the Asset Master Report (AMR) is 100% accurate
Prepares bulk uploads for mass updates to the EBS system
Researches and assists in resolving contract issues
Creates and maintains spreadsheets for funding, billing, and expense tracking
output_json.job_location: Remote with ability to travel to specified locations
output_json.travel_requirements: Ability to travel to specified locations
output_json.company_information: CompTech is committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

other.content: Human Resources at (937) 228-2667 or email stefanie.wallace@comptech.com
